sub_title: Disaster Management and WASH Specialist/Urban Development Specialist
summary:
International Urban and Regional Development Expert with 20 years of experience of which 8 years in a developing context. Specialised in governance, disaster risk mitigation, post disaster reconstruction and rehabilitation, project leadership and management, green, resilient  and inclusive urban development, urban service delivery - water supply and sanitation, drainage, flood water risk management, solid waste management, infrastructure, transport planning -, poverty reduction, gender and social inclusion, institutional capacity building and training, quality control and impact assessment. 

Runs her own company Atelier O2. Atelier O2 designs and manages projects in the field of international urban and regional development and disaster risk management involving multi-stakeholders, leading complex policy dialogue with high level national, provincial and local government and delivering results for clients. The company is strong in leadership and management, developing innovative solutions and planning and implementing an integrative approach.


Proven leadership qualities and first rate drafting and communication skills. 

Karin’s goal is to contribute to green, resilient and inclusive improvement of the living environment for the poor.

profile_positions.description:
Senior Quality Assurance Advisor and Team-Leader (a.i.) in the Community Based Reconstruction and Rehabilitation Project in Central and West Java and Yogyakarta Special Region (TF 090014-IND). The multi-donor funded 70 million US dollar Project is one of the world’s largest community based disaster risk management and reconstruction projects. It comprises 256 villages in three provinces in Java and the city of Yogyakarta, with 6 million inhabitants, that were damaged by earthquakes and a tsunami in 2006, and 88 villages damaged by a vulcano eruption in 2010, resettlement of landslide prone villages due to erosion managing 100 field staff and approximately 300 field workers. 
The Project allocates funds directly to the communities of disaster prone villages. These funds are used for earthquake resistant housing reconstruction, disaster risk mitigation training and tertiary infrastructure improvements which mitigate disaster risk ( Improved dams, dikes and floodgates to prevent flooding, improvement and widening of drainage channels and removing of bottlenecks, riverbank protection works to mitigate riverbank erosion, retaining walls to mitigate landslide risks, terracing and reforestation of steep slopes to mitigate landslide risks voluntary resettlement from hazardous areas, especially landslide areas, reforestation of coastal areas to mitigate tsunami impact and coastal erosion, rainwater harvesting to mitigate the impact of draughts, evacuation sites and evacuation routes, evacuation plans and simulation drills, improved access roads for emergency vehicles).
		
She was as Team Leader a.i. responsible for management of the project, representing the project during missions of international donor organisations, ministries and streamlining the progress with all stakeholders involved.

Setting up and coordinating the Merapi recovery extention project after the eruption of the vulcano Merapi. 88 destroyed villages and livelyhoods have been reconstructed in safe areas.

profile_positions.description:
Associate expert to the National Planning Ministry in a nation wide decentralisation programme. UNDP/UN-Habitat implemented a nation-wide decentralisation programme that trained the central, provincial and local governments to prepare five-year-investment plans for the provision of urban infrastructure services to medium and large cities. These investment-plans funded the provision of housing, infrastructure, transport planning, water and sanitation, drainage, transport, solid waste management, etc. 

Karin was working with the National Planning Ministry in a national “Think Tank” of international experts that designed and prepared roles and regulations for each government level in this decentralisation process.
She developed and introduced the appraisal role, responsibilities and tasks of the provincial governments.
